meanings.definition: To rear up on the hind legs, as a horse.
meanings.sent1: The horse will cabre when it gets scared.
meanings.sent2: The stallion cabre gracefully during the show.
meanings.sent3: The horse tried to cabre but ended up looking silly.
meanings.sent4: The wild stallion cabre like a majestic creature.
meanings.sent5: The cabre of the horse was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A movement in ballet in which the dancer bends backwards from the waist while balancing on one leg.
meanings.sent1: The ballet performance included a stunning cabre.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her cabre for hours to perfect it.
meanings.sent3: The cabre in the ballet routine always wows the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her cabre was like a graceful arch in the air.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's cabre was the highlight of the show.

meanings.sent1: The flamenco performance featured a passionate cabre.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved in sync during the cabre.
meanings.sent3: The cabre in the Spanish dance added flair to the routine.
meanings.sent4: The cabre in the flamenco was full of energy and emotion.
meanings.sent5: The traditional cabre captivated the audience.
